page.title: 02Sharnbrook, The Village
page.content: The core of the village is the High Street with its{stone cottages,}many of them 'listed buildings' dating back to the{17th. and 18th. centuries,}when the population of about 200 was mainly { engaged in agricultural work.}There was some linear development from late Victorian times to the 1930's, but{the {coming of the railway, in 1857, does {not seem to have made a great impact. Sharnbrook's expansion really began in the late 1960's, almost 10 years after the station closed! Two housing estates, with properties in a variety of price ranges, were developed. Both estates are centrally situated, yet they do not encroach upon the quaint appearance of the older part of the village. Today most of the adults among the 2000 inhabitants are{white {collar workers.} There is no industry, and the farms are fully mechanised.
